typeInfo.label: Assets
typeInfo.value:
Represents the value of assets in U.S. dollars organized in four categories: residential, commercial, industrial and essential facilities. Information on types of assets and values were extracted from the FEMA-HAZUS database (Scawthorn et al. 2006)

Scawthorn, Charles, Paul Flores, Neil Blais, Hope Seligson, Eric Tate, Stephanie Chang, Edward Mifflin, et al. 2006. HAZUS-MH Flood Loss Estimation Methodology. II. Damage and Loss Assessment. Natural Hazards Review 7 (2) (May): 72â€“81. doi:10.1061/(ASCE)1527-6988(2006)7:2(72).

geographyInfo.label: Geography
geographyInfo.value: Values were originally obtained by block level and aggregated to census tracts and counties.

valuesInfo.label: Display map values by
valuesInfo.value:
Total Value: Total U.S dollar value of the asset in the spatial unit, aggregated from the block level.

Percent Total: Represents percentage of change with respect to the total value taken as reference in the present day (2010).

graphInfo.label: Distribution of Assets by Elevation Graph
graphInfo.value: Spatial distribution (map) and aggregates by ground height (graph) of value ($) of assets of each type of buildings: Residential, Commercial, Industrial and Essential Facilities. Data source: FEMA-HAZUS

y-axis.label: Graph Y-Axis
y-axis.value: Represents the value of assets in U.S. dollars (billions).

Other.label: Essential Facilities
Other.value: Includes Schools, Farms, Government Offices, Fire and Police stations.

tab.label: Exposure
tab.value: This tab describes the current distribution of assets by building type and elevation across the Gulf of Mexico.

typeInfo.label: Hazard Type
typeInfo.value: Represents the expected damages associated with either a Flood or Wind event.

growthInfo.label: Economic Growth Scenario
growthInfo.value:
Economic scenarios represent different future estimates of economic growth. For each future timeline (2030 and 2050), future values of assets are projected by:

Low - 1% economic growth and 0.5% demographic growth.

High - 2% economic growth and 1% deomgraphic growth.

These estimates were chosen considering (1) historical rates and (2) projections for the region.

defenseInfo.label: Landscape Defenses
defenseInfo.value:
Consider the effects of existing coastal geomorphology features on reducing current and future storm damages by attenuating waves and storm surges. Choices are:

None - assumes that features have no effect on waves or surge (i.e., if they disappeared);

Low - assumes that features have low or conservatively-estimated effects on wave & surge;

Best - assumes best (most accurate) estimates of the effects of these features on waves & surge.

geographyInfo.label: Geography
geographyInfo.value: Values were originally obtained by block level and aggregated to census tracts and counties.

assetInfo.label: Reference Year for Assets
assetInfo.value: Future timelines used for estimating Risks.

climateInfo.label: Reference Year
climateInfo.value: Future timelines used for estimating Risks.

protectionInfo.label: Storm Return Period (year)
protectionInfo.value: Considers the type of storm based on models of past storms; storms with higher return periods are less frequent and more intense.

valuesInfo.label: Display map values by
valuesInfo.value:
Total Value: Total U.S dollar of the average losses distributed on a yearly basis (Annual Expected Damages) in the spatial unit.

Percent Change: Represents percentage of change with respect to the total value taken as reference in the present day (2010).

graphInfo.label: Risk Profile Graph
graphInfo.value: Risk evolution between 2010 and future conditions (2030 or 2050) for the different economic scenarios and landscape protection. Bars represent current risk (left) and future risks (right), distinguishing the contribution of economic growth and climate change.

y-axis.label: Risk Profile Graph Y-Axis
y-axis.value: Total amount of damages in U.S. dollars (billions).

x-axis.label: Risk Profile Graph X-Axis
x-axis.value: Risk associated with the present day (2010), the contribution from economic growth alone, the contribution from future climate alone, and the future (including the combined increase from both economic growth and climate change) relative to expected damages in 2010.

tab.label: Risk
tab.value: This tab provides an assessment of risk values, now and in the future (years 2030 and 2050), from the contribution of economic development and changes in climate (sea level rise and storms).

slider_error.label: Invalid Information
slider_error.value: Data with a combination of Assets in ASSETYEAR and Climate in CLIMATEYEAR does not exist. Sliders have been automatically adjusted to an allowable combination.

Economic.label: Expected Future Damages from Economy
Economic.value: $VALUE (US) in expected damages in the future from economic growth alone representing a PERCENT increase relative to expected damages in 2010.

Climate.label: Expected Future Damages from Climate
Climate.value: $VALUE (US) in expected damages in the future from climate change alone representing a PERCENT increase relative to expected damages in 2010.

Total.label: Expected Future Damages in FUTUREYEAR
Total.value: $VALUE (US) in total expected damages in the future (including increase from both economic growth and climate change) representing a PERCENT increase relative to expected damages in 2010.

typeInfo.label: Restoration Success
typeInfo.value:
Alters the assumed cost and effectiveness of nature-based defenses (restored wetlands, reefs, beaches and barrier islands). Choices are:

Best - assumes best (most accurate) estimates of the costs and effects of these nature-based defenses on waves & surge based on existing literature and engineering models;

More Conservative - assumes that features have lower effects on waves or surge than Best estimates above;

Most Conservative - assumes that features have both lower effects (by 30-50%) and higher costs (by 20%) than Best estimates.

growthInfo.label: Economic Growth Scenario
growthInfo.value:
Economic scenarios represent different future estimates of economic growth. For each future timeline (2030 and 2050), future values of assets are projected by:

Low - 1% economic growth and 0.5% demographic growth.

High - 2% economic growth and 1% deomgraphic growth.

These estimates were chosen considering (1) historical rates and (2) projections for the region.

defenseInfo.label: Landscape Defenses
defenseInfo.value:
Consider the effects of existing coastal geomorphology features on reducing current and future storm damages by attenuating waves and storm surges. Choices are:

None - assumes that features have no effect on waves or surge (i.e., if they disappeared);

Low - assumes that features have low or conservatively-estimated effects on wave & surge;

Best - assumes best (most accurate) estimates of the effects of these features on waves & surge.

climateInfo.label: Reference Year
climateInfo.value: Future timelines used for estimating Adaptation and Risk Reduction.

valuesInfo.label: Display map values by
valuesInfo.value:
Total Value: Total U.S dollar of the average losses distributed on a yearly basis (Annual Expected Damages) averted in the spatial unit.

Percent Total: Represents the percentage of the total Annual Expected Damages averted.

graphInfo.label: Cost : Benefit Curve Graph
graphInfo.value: Comparison of the costs and benefits of Risk Reduction measures for different scenarios. The vertical axis represents the benefit:cost ratio where the higher the bar, the more cost-effective of a solution. The horizontal axis notes the averted damage (i.e. benefit) and the width of the bars the benefit of each individual measure.

x-axis.label: Cost : Benefit Curve Graph X-Axis
x-axis.value: Represents total losses avoided in U.S. dollars. Note the wider the bar, the greater the amount of damages averted

y-axis.label: Cost : Benefit Curve Graph Y-Axis
y-axis.value: Represents the benefit:cost ratio.  Note the higher the bar, the more cost-effective of a solution.

oysters.label: Oyster Reef Restoration
oysters.value:
Artificial construction of oyster reefs; restoration of 25 miles of oyster reefs in each of 24 counties with suitable habitat, for Tampa Bay 25 miles is divided among 3 counties.

Click to show the counties with this measure in place.

wetlandrisk.label: Wetland Restoration - Risk Reduction Priority
wetlandrisk.value:
Salt marsh restoration built along shorelines in 0.5 sq mile units (1 mile x 0.5 mile) in the 6 counties with highest past asset damages & loss of > 25 sq miles of marsh.

Click to show the counties with this measure in place.

wetlandconservation.label: Wetland Restoration - Conservation Priority
wetlandconservation.value:
Salt marsh restoration built along shorelines in 0.5 sq mile units (1 mile x 0.5 mile) in the 5 counties that have lost the most marsh in the last 2 decades.

Click to show the counties with this measure in place.

barrier.label: Barrier Island Restoration
barrier.value:
Restoration of island barriers by increasing width; in Alabama and Louisiana counties.

Click to show the counties with this measure in place.

beach.label: Beach Nourishment
beach.value:
Artificial beach nourishment to increase beach width in high risk area areas, counties with significant beach fronts across Florida.

Click to show the counties with this measure in place.

levees.label: Local Levees
levees.value:
Six foot levees built to protect houses; all houses in the counties in highest risk areas.

Click to show the counties with this measure in place.

sandbags.label: Sandbags
sandbags.value:
Sandbags used around homes for Category 3 hurricanes or above; located in all counties around all houses in low-lying areas (below 10m).

Click to show the counties with this measure in place.

other.label: Home Elevation
other.value:
Homes elevated by 10 feet.

Click to show the counties with this measure in place.

cb-ratio.label: Benefit:Cost Line
cb-ratio.value: Threshold where the benefits provided by a measure equal that of the cost to implement it, that is the benefit:cost ratio equals 1.  Benefit:cost ratios above a value of 1 represent particularly effective adaptation measures relative to their cost to implement.

tab.label: Solutions
tab.value: This tab provides the reduction in risk and the benefit:cost ratio of different adaptation measures in the Gulf of Mexico.

graph-bar.label: NAME
graph-bar.value: Benefit:cost ratio for avoided damages from present to FUTUREYEAR is CBRATIO with a total amount of $CBDAMAGE (US) in damages averted.
